questionListItems.title: How are CTP project proposals evaluated?

answer.body:
Proposals are evaluated on a case-by-case basis, taking into consideration the merits and impact level of projects. Companies can be nominated by WSG or Sectoral Agencies.


Proposals should also articulate firm plans to bring in new capabilities that will be localised within the local workforce.

questionListItems.title: How can a company benefit from the CTP?

answer.body: Through CTP, companies can receive funding support for approved project proposals to develop their workforce through the acquisition of new capabilities.

questionListItems.title: Which sectors are supported under CTP?

answer.body: Meritorious capability development proposals across all sectors, including the 23 Industry Transformation Map (ITM) sectors, can be supported under CTP.

questionListItems.title: What is the Capability Transfer Programme (CTP)?

answer.body:
The CTP supports companies/associations/professional bodies in building deep capabilities in our local workforce by facilitating the transfer of new global capabilities from foreign specialists to locals in Singapore.


The CTP aims to improve local-foreign workforce complementarity by encouraging:

  • A culture of pervasive capabilities transfer across all sectors and entities; and
  • The development and acquiring of new capabilities in Singapore to ensure a sufficient supply of locals with the requisite skillsets"

questionListItems.title: Are there any stipulated operating hours or downtime for MyCareersFuture?

answer.body: MyCareersFuture is accessible 24 hours a day, seven days a week. We will inform users of service disruptions during system maintenance of the Portal.

questionListItems.title: Who should I contact if I encounter issues with my Corppass?

answer.body:
For queries related to Corppass, you may contact the Corppass Helpdesk at +65 6643 0577 or email support@corppass.gov.sg for assistance.


Operating Hours:

Mondays to Fridays: 8 am to 8 pm

Saturdays: 8 am to 2 pm

Closed on Sundays and Public Holidays

questionListItems.title: Who should I contact if I encounter issues with my Singpass?

answer.body:
For queries related to Singpass login, you may contact the Singpass Helpdesk at +65 6643 0555 or email support@singpass.gov.sg for assistance.


Operating Hours:

Mondays to Fridays: 8 am to 8 pm

Saturdays: 8 am to 2 pm

Closed on Sundays and Public Holidays

questionListItems.title: Will MyCareersFuture be integrated with MySkillsFuture?

answer.body: There are currently no plans to integrate MyCareersFuture with MySkillsFuture to become one portal. WSG and SSG will continue to enhance the two portals, working closely with the skills-tojob matching tech providers to better harmonise the skills listed on both portals and ensure they are kept current and relevant to the labour market and industry needs, and through the adoption of skills defined in the Skills Frameworks.

questionListItems.title: How does MyCareersFuture work in tandem with MySkillsFuture, and vice versa?

answer.body:
Individuals can identify their skills and skills gaps for jobs that they wish to apply for, and browse relevant available courses and skills development options on MySkillsFuture and get advice on the relevant course providers for them to approach and to enrol with.


Jobseekers currently visit MyCareersFuture mainly for job search purposes. They can browse and apply for jobs that best fit their current and ready skills. If the jobs they are interested to apply for do not match their current skills sets, they can then check out MySkillsFuture to browse for courses that would help them upskill.

questionListItems.title: Why are there two Government portals to help Singaporeans find jobs using skills? Can’t we just have one overall portal?

answer.body:
MyCareersFuture and MySkillsFuture support the needs of Singaporeans at different stages of their life and career journey. As jobs and skills are closely inter-linked, the two portals are therefore built to complement each other to ensure varied needs are met.


MySkillsFuture is designed to serve individuals who would like to understand their skills needs, and develop the skills that will enable them to achieve their learning and career aspirations. MyCareersFuture serves those who are actively searching for jobs to apply to and those who want to review existing career directions and explore new job opportunities.


Collectively, the two portals reflect the Government’s Smart Nation objectives, and deliver a customised, user-friendly and technology-driven experience for citizens and employers who are seeking skills training and employment/manpower solutions.

questionListItems.title: Can I use terms like ‘AND’, ‘OR’, ‘NOT’ in Talent Search?

answer.body: Yes, the search engine supports Boolean searches.

questionListItems.title: Are the talents currently unemployed and immediately available?

answer.body: The talents are open to job opportunities and they should be considered fairly regardless of employment status

questionListItems.title: Do the talents know that I am looking at their profile?

answer.body: No, the talents do not know who is looking at their profile through Talent Search.

questionListItems.title: Who are in the talent pool that I’m searching against for Talent Search?

answer.body: They are MyCareersFuture registered users who have their profiles set to ‘open to job opportunities’.

questionListItems.title: What happens when I remove the screening questions from my job posting?

answer.body: After removing the screening questions from the job posting, employers are not allowed to add back any screening question, and all screening questions responses captured will be removed as well. This is to ensure that all applicants are assessed equally, either with screening questions responses or without screening questions responses.
